column4: moldy: current stable kernel in 8.04.1 is already at 2.6.24-19, and there's 2.6.24-20 in hardy-proposed
what do i have to do to see the .19? aptitude search does not show it
oh, i just read that i need 2.6.25 actually. can i install this whithout compiling it myself?
that one you will have to compile yourself yes, i think only intrepid has that
it's not possible to use a backport of the kernel from intrepid?
might be possible yes, might also create dependency hell .. is there anything special you need the -25 for ?
yes, the NIC in a thin client
the driver in .24 is broken, and earlier kernels seem to have other fatal issues :-/
out of curiosity: why do i not see the 24-19 kernel?
i see, well, it's either compile yourself or if you have the spare HD space you could install Intrepid and test it from there
you might have to look at your sources.list and check which repositories you have active in there, you should see it at least
ah, now i see the driver. how painful is a hardy  -> intrepid upgrade ?
moldy: there is no upgrade from hardy to intrepid yet, as INtrepid is still in alpha testing fase
i will either buy the other client or compile the kernel myself.
you're welcome .. ask around in #ubuntu+1 for intrepid
